b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (06:58): Uviz,  if you want you can show me a part of it
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (06:58): and i can tell you how it is ?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (06:59): Hah, it's not about sections, you have to read the whole thing because I'm going through configuration of each component rather than the scenario.

f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:01): i.e. For configuring each IP-based virtual host with single server/engine using mod_jk, I go through Apache configuration entirely, then mod_jk, and at last Tomcat.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:02): i would only describe the part related to mod_jk
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:02): So all scenarios get to cover Apache virtual host configuration first, then mod_jk/proxy, etc...
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:02): I don't know how to do mod_proxy that's why I want to add that section as well.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:02): In the process I may learn something.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:03): yeah sure you will
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:03): i think i have a good example of mod_proxy + mod_rewrite for you
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:03): I try so hard not to complicated the matter or add extranous features whcih I don't fully understand.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:04): ok i see
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:04): juts go step by step
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:04): mod_rewrite? Why do you need mod_rewrite?
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:04): so you can optmize your urls for SEO
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:04): With mod_proxy, it seems like you have to add an entry to Apache config file everytime you want to deploy a new application, don't you?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:05): That's something I would like to avoid.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:06): and i think i know why :)
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:07): the overhead of reconfiguring each time a new app is deplyed ?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:07): Well, not exactly an overhead but what if I've 10 developers each doing their own thing, spawning web application after another...
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:08): I don't want them to wait for the admin to update the config file each time they deploy a new webapp.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:08): That just doesn't make sense.
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:09): Besides, how can you enforce such setup to tell Apache to handle static content and Tomcat to take care of dynamic content?
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:09): that is the same case also with mod_jk
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:09): you need to edit your workers properties
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:10): or you jkmount ..
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:10): Why the workers?
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:10): You just do JkUnMount /*.html worker and be done with it.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:10): i mean the Jkmount
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:11): Now all my .html files are handled through Apache but how do you do that with mod_proxy?
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:11): but in the old mod_jk2 the process of mounting contexts was done in the workers.proerties file thast why i said that
f79b910ed55c817c3286ef127fa464fc (07:11): Oh, I see, good to know.
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:11): Uviz, btw here is the link http://cocoondev.org/books/daisydocs1_4/publications/html-chunked/output/dsy99.html#dsy99
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:12): mod_proxy and mod_rewrite in action
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:12): in this case its specially for daisy
b6f1fcd73f30aeff93ca1c52043e7771 (07:12): but you could generalize that
